com.symyx.draw
Class JDrawEditor

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Panel
              java.applet.Applet
                  javax.swing.JApplet
                      com.symyx.draw.JDrawEditor
All Implemented Interfaces:
JDrawComponent, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer
public class JDrawEditor
extends javax.swing.JApplet
implements JDrawComponent

Class for editing structures (molecules and reactions) in an applet, which can also have a renderer: see JDrawRenderer. Typically, the structure is represented by a molfile or rxnfile. To learn about the molfile and rxnfile formats, see www.symyx.com/downloads/public/ctfile/ctfile.pdf.

See Also:
Serialized Form

preferences

public JDrawPreferences preferences()
Description copied from interface: JDrawComponent
Returns the preference manager object, a unified object that provides access to preference values. For example, 

someJDrawAppletInstance.preferences().setHydrogenDisplayMode(PreferenceManager.HYDROGEN_TERMINAL)
Note: Calling this method automatically redraws the canvas of an applet.

Specified by:
preferences in interface JDrawComponent

getMolString

public java.lang.String getMolString()
Description copied from interface: JDrawComponent
Returns a String that represents the molecule or reaction currently displayed. A molfile string is the content of a molfile (.mol) or rxnfile (.rxn), and it contains line feed and/or carriage returns as line separators.

Specified by:
getMolString in interface JDrawComponent
Returns:
String the molecule or reaction currently displayed.

getRxnString

public java.lang.String getRxnString()
Description copied from interface: JDrawComponent
Returns a string that returns the reaction. Note: RxnStrings are a subset of MolStrings that represents reactions. Whereas setRxnString and setMolstring both work with molecules and reactions, getRxnString returns soley reaction data (or null if no reaction is drawn on the canvas).

Specified by:
getRxnString in interface JDrawComponent
Returns:
a string that represents the reaction

setHydrogenDisplayMode

public boolean setHydrogenDisplayMode(int i)
Description copied from interface: JDrawComponent
Determines which hydrogen atoms are displayed.
  • 0 for none
  • 1 for hydrogens attached to heteroatoms
  • 2 for terminal hydrogens (not inside chains)
  • 3 for hetereo or terminal
  • 4 for all

Default is 0.

If the value is outside the range or the editor does not have a renderer ready for accepting setting the preference, the call is ignored and false is returned.

Specified by:
setHydrogenDisplayMode in interface JDrawComponent
